text:
Hi everyone! Baby coder here who knows enough to be dangerous but nowhere near enough to build an API :melting_face:

We're about to launch our HubSpot website, which uses a custom object to create data-driven dynamic "profiles" for 200+ vendors on our site. We have a ton of webforms that we use to collect information for these profiles to make sure we have the most up-to-date info. Based on our scope, our 3rd party developer built workflows that push data from contact records --> custom object rather than having a 2-way sync for all these 700+ properties (as one company could have multiple products to submit info on and update).

Unfortunately, our 3rd party developer built our environment & workflows from forms --> custom object in such a way that it's seamless to *create* a new record, but no guardrails in place to prevent dupes and *updated* a record instead. And naturally, HubSpot workflows work great for *creating a new record* with mass properties being updated at once, but *updating an existing record in bulk* is not possible with the current workflow functionality and the *merge function* doesn't truly combine records in a way that we need to.

My questions:
1. Is there a way to do some kind of vlookup within our custom objects by record name, company name, etc. AND do a mass update of multiple properties if an existing record is found?
2. HubSpot support said we may need an API to be able to both mass update records and/or push data back from our custom objects --> contact properties if edits are made to the data within the custom object for the dynamic website "profiles".
Any guidance would be very much appreciated!
